page.title: 06IRON WORKS
page.content: The iron works was in{Hareshaw Lynn. It was a place where iron ore was taken from the ground and {smelted}in coke ovens.They sent the iron to Tyneside to be sold. Some was used to build the High Level Bridge in Newcastle. The workers lived in tiny houses specially built,but now there is only one short terrace left and the names Foundry Farm and Foundry Yard. Here small{factories}are now being built. About ten years ago there was a flood which altered the course of the stream revealing an old wagon truck and rails used in the{iron works. All around the countryside small humps can be seen.They were spoil heaps from the{mines.}Now they are grass covered and some have special names like the{Blue Heaps}at Blakelaw.
